skill.name: FastAPI Development
skill.description: Build async APIs with FastAPI, including endpoints, dependency injection, validation, and testing. Use when creating REST APIs, web backends, or microservices.
skill.summary: Build async APIs with FastAPI, including endpoints, dependency injection, validation, and testing. U...
skill.author: bossjones

security_audit.summary: This skill contains legitimate FastAPI documentation and code examples. All static analysis findings were false positives - the 'external_commands' were markdown code blocks, not actual shell execution. No security risks identified.

content.user_title: Build FastAPI applications with async endpoints
content.value_statement: FastAPI makes building high-performance APIs simple with automatic validation and interactive documentation. This skill helps you create production-ready async APIs with proper validation, testing, and dependency injection.
actual_capabilities: Create FastAPI applications with async endpoints
Implement Pydantic models for request/response validation
Set up dependency injection for shared logic
Configure path and query parameter validation
limitations: Async database operations need additional setup
Production deployment requires proper server configuration
Large file uploads may need special handling

use_cases.title: Build REST APIs quickly
use_cases.description: Create high-performance REST APIs with automatic OpenAPI documentation and validation

use_cases.title: Design async microservices
use_cases.description: Build scalable microservices with proper dependency injection and error handling

use_cases.title: Learn modern API development
use_cases.description: Start with FastAPI's intuitive syntax and built-in features for rapid prototyping

prompt_templates.title: Basic API endpoint
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a FastAPI endpoint at /users/{user_id} that returns user data with proper type hints and validation

prompt_templates.title: POST with validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a POST endpoint /items/ that accepts JSON with name, price, and optional description fields using Pydantic models

prompt_templates.title: Database integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a FastAPI app with SQLAlchemy dependency injection for database operations and proper connection cleanup

prompt_templates.title: Advanced authentication
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a FastAPI app with JWT authentication, protected routes, and user registration endpoints using OAuth2PasswordBearer

output_examples.input: Create a FastAPI app with CRUD operations for a product inventory
output: Creates main.py with FastAPI app instance
Implements Pydantic models for Product creation and response
Adds GET /products/ endpoint to list all products
Creates POST /products/ endpoint to add new products
Implements GET /products/{id} to retrieve specific product
Includes proper error handling for not found items
Provides test file with TestClient examples

best_practices: Use Pydantic models for all request/response validation to ensure data integrity
Implement proper dependency injection for database connections and shared services
Write comprehensive tests using TestClient before deploying to production
anti_patterns: Avoid blocking operations in async endpoints - use async libraries
Do not hardcode database credentials - use environment variables
Never skip input validation even for internal APIs

faq.question: What Python version does FastAPI require?
faq.answer: FastAPI requires Python 3.8 or higher for full compatibility with async features

faq.question: How do I run the development server?
faq.answer: Use 'uvicorn main:app --reload' where main is your Python file and app is your FastAPI instance

faq.question: Does FastAPI support automatic API documentation?
faq.answer: Yes, visit /docs for Swagger UI or /redoc for ReDoc documentation automatically generated from your code

faq.question: Can I use synchronous database libraries?
faq.answer: Use async database libraries like asyncpg or databases package for better performance with FastAPI

faq.question: How do I handle file uploads?
faq.answer: Use UploadFile from fastapi import to handle multipart file uploads with streaming support

faq.question: What testing framework should I use?
faq.answer: FastAPI includes TestClient based on Requests library for easy endpoint testing
